Charity and I had a great weekend in Ross County! We stopped by the Apple Harvest Open House at @HirschFruitFarm and the Oktoberfest put on by @downtownchilli.

There’s nowhere better to enjoy the changing of the leaves than Ohio’s Second Congressional District, and we had a great time celebrating the first day of fall with good company!

The Working Families Tax Cut is a win for hardworking American families & seniors in Ohio, saving the average Ohio family $1,207 a year.

Read more in my op ed: https://t.co/Om9NHfWYzU

The Alliance for Pharmacy Compounding represents over 600 member pharmacies, ensuring the safety and accessibility of prescription medication in our communities.

This week, I talked with them about the importance of solving prescription drug shortages and ensuring patients have access to the medicines they need.

.@NSSGA is the world’s largest mining association by volume and represents America’s construction and aggregates industry, employing over 100,000 people at over 9,000 facilities.

The products produced by this industry are fundamental for building safe and reliable roads, airports, transit, rail, ports, clean water, and energy networks.

As a member of @TransportGOP, I’m committed to advocating for the needs of our transportation industry, and it was great talking with NSSGA about how best I can do just that.

It’s time to make our roads safe again! 

Congress must pass my bill,
Connor’s Law, to do just that.

Today I voted for a resolution honoring the life of Charlie Kirk, a true American patriot.

His legacy of patriotism, faith, & free speech will continue for decades in our Nation, & my continued thoughts & prayers are with the loved ones he left behind. https://t.co/ztRYkrpexA

President Trump is ensuring our Nation remains a world leader in trade, keeping business flowing for local farmers & ranchers while ensuring both free & fair trade.

Throughout his life, Officer Matthew Juniper of the Wellston Police Department demonstrated a deep commitment to his community through serving as a police officer, a former deputy sheriff, and a volunteer firefighter.

It is people like Matthew who put service above self that make our Nation the exceptional place it is. I know his legacy will continue throughout his community for years to come.

Celebrating 78 years of unmatched air power & dominance. 🇺🇸

We salute each airman & woman who’s made the @usairforce the unstoppable fighting force it is today.

Happy birthday, Air Force! https://t.co/LdQrUt5dSg

238 years ago, the most incredible constitution in the world was penned, enshrining the values that still guide our Nation today.

I swore by it when I took the oath of office in January, and I continue to celebrate and defend it today.

Happy Constitution Day 🇺🇸 https://t.co/jfosKGa5Jd

Yesterday I talked with @OhioEggFarmers & @CooperFarms_ about how avian influenza is impacting the poultry industry & what challenges they’re navigating with animal health.

Cooper Farms is a family-owned business in Northwest Ohio that raises turkeys, egg layers, & hogs. The doubled agriculture trade funding in the Working Families Tax Cut will help give businesses like theirs a helping hand.

Even though many agriculture wins were passed in this bill, I’m continuing to push for a Farm Bill 2.0 that further supports the needs of Ohio farmers, ranchers, & producers.

Getting to talk with passionate students makes me optimistic about the future of Ohio’s agriculture industry!

I chatted with bright students from @WilmingtonColl about preserving prime farmland, how the tax cuts for small businesses and farms in the Working Families Tax Cut help family farms, and how Congress is making it easier for farms to be passed down to the next generation.

I’m excited to see how these students will make an impact in Ohio’s agriculture industry in the coming years!

To keep American business moving forward, we need safe & reliable ways to transport goods & materials. @tianetdotorg represents over 2,000 companies nationwide that do business across our Nation & overseas, with an estimated economic footprint of $343 billion.

Yesterday I met with Tom Curee of Qued, Luke McComas of Triple T Transport, Heather Devine from @Traffix1979, & Solomiya Tomkiv of Wirebee, & heard the challenges facing our transportation & business industries today.

As a member of @TransportGOP, I’m continuing to advocate for a strong Surface Transportation Reauthorization Act to keep our Nation’s highways, transit, & rails in working order & advocating for the needs of American businesses.

The Ohio Society for Respiratory Care advocates for patients who depend on respiratory care to live their lives to the fullest.

Today I talked with them about how Congress can ensure Ohioans have access to the care they need.

Thank you for stopping by! https://t.co/ApbqIVOmSd

Thanks @SteveScalise for the celebratory cookie cake!

Proud to see the House pass my Water Resources Technical Assistance Review Act to deliver critical water infrastructure resources to the rural Americans who need them the most. https://t.co/FAm25DcLmO

Last night I joined my colleagues in a prayer vigil honoring the life of a true American patriot.

Charlie Kirk was an unabashed example of the free speech that’s enshrined in our Constitution, & his bold voice inspired countless young Americans to think for themselves & engage in civil discourse.

His legacy will continue for decades to come.

This year, Ohio’s Second Congressional District is the proud home of BOTH Miss Ohio and Miss Ohio’s Teen!

Allison Payton and Olivia Fosson are outstanding young women setting an example for their peers of leadership, service, & excellence.

We are proud of their accomplishments & look forward to seeing what they’ll achieve in the years ahead!

September is Hunger Action Month & a reminder for each of us to do our part to support those in need around us.

Donating non-perishable items to local food banks, supporting community food drives, & volunteering your time are great ways to give back to our community.

I look forward to continuing to listen to & advocate for our local food banks to ensure no Ohioan goes hungry.

To keep America moving forward, we must equip our workforce with the tools & skills they need to succeed.

It was great meeting with @AGCofA leadership today to discuss how Congress can strengthen pipelines for trained workers & protect contractors from unfair risk & liability. https://t.co/c9LBMaMlcK

I’m proud to say that today the House passed my bill, the Water Resources Technical Assistance Review Act! 
 
For too long, rural communities have been boxed out of receiving water resources from the EPA that they should have had access to the whole time. Thank you to @TransportGOP Chairman @RepSamGraves for your support in moving this bill forward for OH-02 & rural communities across our Nation.
 
I urge the Senate to quickly pass this bill & deliver these resources to the communities they were designed to serve.

Happy Birthday to the best mom anyone could ever ask for!

Thanks Mom, for all the love and care you’ve poured into our family. None of this would be possible without you! Love you! Have an amazing day! https://t.co/DBPRE7Vpj6

How are @HouseGOP & President Trump Making Rural America Healthy Again?

By delivering $50 BILLION in funding to rural healthcare facilities through the Rural Health Transformation Program, passed in the Working Families Tax Cut.

https://t.co/cGtMgApClv

🚨🚨 Applications are open for @USDA’s Farm to School grants!

It’s great to see President Trump & @SecRollins prioritizing nutritious food in our Nation’s schools, all while supporting local family farmers.

This is a win for Ohio farmers, a win for students, and a win for America 🇺🇸

With nearly 3 million hogs, Ohio is the 8th largest pork-producing state in our Nation and @OhioPork represents our outstanding Buckeye pork farmers.

This week we talked about how Congress must fix Proposition 12 to cut red tape and allow our local agriculture industry to thrive.

As a member of @HouseAgGOP, I’m pushing hard to deliver results that Ohio farmers need to do their jobs and help our local agriculture economy thrive.

It was great meeting with Co-Founder Wiley Rhodes and VP Caitlin Holley of @TrilliumH2Power this week to talk about American energy dominance and how to streamline the regulatory and permitting process.

President Trump is unleashing American energy and I look forward to advocating for power companies in southern Ohio that provide the energy our communities need to keep moving forward!

The Working Families Tax Cut will lower taxes for hardworking Ohio families, make a historic investment in rural healthcare and small businesses, secure our borders, & protect critical programs for vulnerable Americans.

I was proud to support it and will continue advocating for the needs of Buckeye families in Congress.

It’s always an honor to shake the hand of one of our country’s Heroes. This week I met with the Ohio VFW to talk about veterans’ needs, the state of our local VA centers, and what I’m doing in Congress to support our heroes.

I introduced the Veterans First Act of 2025 earlier this year to ensure State Veterans Homes across our country are equipped with the funding and facilities to meet our veterans’ needs.

In serving our country, these veterans put our Nation first, and now it’s time to return the favor. 🇺🇸

This week I talked with the Ohio Farmers Union about the importance of strengthening the farm safety net and improving farmer-friendly conservation programs.

I appreciated hearing from them about how they’re building strong and resilient rural communities and I look forward to doing my part by speaking up for their needs in Congress.

The Greater Cincinnati Automobile Dealers Association represents 95 franchised car dealers in the greater Cincinnati area and provides training to dealership principals and employees.

This week I talked with them about how provisions of my USA CAR Act, passed in the Working Families Tax Cut, will benefit both consumers and dealers through the creation of a tax cut for interest from the purchase of American-made cars.

This will keep money in consumers’ pockets while incentivizing the purchase of American-made cars from our local dealerships.

With agriculture being a top industry in southern Ohio, it’s always a pleasure touching base with the @OhioFarmBureau to hear about their priorities and how I can best advocate for farmers’ needs in Congress.

We talked about the importance of H-2A visas in staffing up farm operations, promoting the year-round sale of E15 in our Nation, and highlighted some of the Farm Bill wins that were passed in the Working Families Tax Cut.

I’ll continue pushing for a robust farm bill to support Ohio’s local farmers, ranchers, and producers, and look forward to keeping in touch with the Ohio Farm Bureau to be the most effective voice I can be for their priorities.

I was honored to join @SpeakerJohnson, @SteveScalise, @GOPMajorityWhip, & @RepLisaMcClain recently to highlight wins for American families in the Working Families Tax Cut.

I’m working with Republicans in Congress & @POTUS to support common sense legislation like this bill to keep money in hardworking Ohioans’ pockets & enable them to prosper.

The month of September is a reminder for each of us to check in with our loved ones and make sure no one feels like they have to face their struggles alone.

If you need support, call 988 for free and confidential support that’s available 24/7. https://t.co/TOboamzDz1

On this day 24 years ago, the world witnessed the unbreakable spirit of America in the midst of tragedy.

We honor the nearly 3,000 lives lost and remember the courage of the first responders.

We will never forget. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/YcQCfNYtc1

Our hearts are breaking with the loss of a faithful husband, a devoted father, and a true American patriot.

Charity and I cannot even imagine the magnitude of loss being felt by Charlie’s loving family. 

May the perpetrator be swiftly brought to justice and prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. Endless calls from the Left for violence must STOP. This has gone too far for too long. 

Thoughts and heartfelt prayers are with Charlie’s loved ones.

This kind of political violence is outrageous and must stop.

Charity and I are praying for Charlie and his family.

Love seeing the Trump Administration continuing to put patients first. 

Americans deserve transparency when it comes to direct-to-consumer drug advertising so they can make safe & informed decisions about their healthcare.  

Congress should take similar action by passing my bill, HR 3789, so prescription drug costs aren’t a secret. 

https://t.co/IE7FBtbRRs

It was great joining the @CincyChamber’s annual fly in yesterday to discuss economic development in our Buckeye state!

I shared how the Working Families Tax Cut is saving small businesses and hardworking families money, and how I’m working in Congress to make a difference for the people of the 2nd District who have been left behind for too long.  It’s time for the promises to end and the results to begin. 

It was wonderful to see former Ohio Senator Rob Portman there, as well.  He is still working hard for Ohio, as always. I look forward to working with these local leaders to help Southern Ohio prosper.

I look forward to nominating Ohio’s best & brightest! https://t.co/6nUISchykN

I’m honored to continue working with President Trump and Republicans in Congress to promote policies that help all Americans live freely, securely, and prosperously. https://t.co/B2ilEABFV1

Next time you see a pharmaceutical advertisement, ask yourself: how much does this medication really cost?

Unless Congress passes my bill, you may never know.

https://t.co/lbL0WjA7pg

As I spent time in OH-02 this August, I heard excitement from Ohioans abut how the One Big Beautiful Bill will help small family businesses thrive, keep money in the pockets of hardworking families, and reinvigorate our local economies. 

I was proud to support it and will continue advocating for the needs of Buckeye families in Congress 🇺🇸

I am saddened to hear of the passing of one of our local law enforcement officers over the holiday weekend.

Officer Matthew Juniper of Wellston, Ohio, was a devoted father, committed volunteer in his community, & a local hero.

My thoughts & prayers are with his family and the Wellston community as they celebrate his life & the impact he had in our region.

https://t.co/KoxJPEqZmu

Next Friday, September 12th, is the final day to turn in your application materials.

It was my pleasure joining the Premier Showman @ohio4h Club Meeting and talking with outstanding youth who are getting hands-on experience in the agriculture industry! This was the largest 4-H meeting I’ve ever attended, and I was blown away by the caliber of young people there. 

Earlier this year, I recognized 4-H member Kenley Juillerat for giving back to veterans in Hillsboro, Ohio through her Stars, Stripes, and Smiles buckets. It was great to catch up with her and her fellow 4-H members and hear what they’re working on now to further their agriculture education and give back to their communities.

The Floor Speech honoring Kenley is available here: https://t.co/yAp2uwD5k8

My office is here to serve YOU.

If you need help with a federal agency, want to request a Capitol tour, or would like to speak with a member of my team to share your priorities, reach out to one of my offices.

More information is available at https://t.co/D1XtH1ouSp. I hope to hear from you soon!

The United Producers Livestock Auction was a lively time!

I received a wonderful tour and got to chat with Facility Manager Caleb Grooms, Office Manager Danielle Combs, and Sales Representative Lauren Grover, who are hard at work ensuring Ohio’s agriculture industry is alive and well.

America is home to one of the most skilled workforces in the world.

Today and every day, we are grateful to the incredible people who keep our Nation moving forward and make our country the great place it is!

Happy Labor Day 🇺🇸 https://t.co/Gx8EZUQ3GM

.@RickIntlAirport is a cargo airport for the city of Columbus that provides safe animal transportation and has additionally served an increasing number of passenger flights and charter carriers since 2012. This airport is also home to the Ohio Army National Guard’s Army Aviation Support Facility No. 2, the headquarters for the Ohio Military Reserve, one of the state defense forces of Ohio, and the 121st Air Refueling Wing.

It was great seeing firsthand what this airport offers our region and getting a glimpse of @anduriltech's facilities next door. I look forward to continuing to advocate for the needs of critical facilities like these in Congress.

I recently headed out to Winchester Industrial Park to talk with Economic Development Director Paul Worley Adams Co about what’s ahead for this area.

With 55 acres of land designated as a Federal Opportunity Zone, this site will see significant economic development and workforce growth in the coming years. @JobsOhio and multiple other local organizations plan to partner with this site to provide water, sewage, electric and road access from State Route 32, with rail and Salamon Airport close by.

I look forward to seeing how the incoming businesses and corporations will create job opportunities for Ohioans right here in Adams County!

I was delighted to join the team at the James A. Rhodes Airport in Jackson County to explore their taxiway project.

This airport services as a cornerstone for regional air traffic and contributes substantially to southeastern Ohio’s economic development.

Thank you to the members of the airport authority and Jackson County Commissioner Paul Haller for talking with me about the importance of this airport for our local community!

It was great sitting down with local business owners and stakeholders from Ohio's Second Congressional District to discuss federal policies and regulations and hear what drives our local businesses to be successful!

Thank you to @HolzerHealth in Jackson for hosting this roundtable, Dorinda Byers of D Byers and Associates for organizing this meeting, and Sam Brady of Jackson County Economic Development for the outstanding work you do in our region.

Raines Farms and Greenhouses is a fifth generation farm producing 1,500 acres of grain, 118 acres of tobacco, and 400 head of cattle.

Their year-round greenhouse supplies annuals, perennials, hanging pots and mums to numerous businesses in Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana, and West Virginia.

It was great talking with brothers Greg and Todd Raines and staff about their business’s growth over the years and how I can support small businesses like theirs in Congress.

Midwest Air in Peebles specializes in aerial application of fertilizer, chemicals, and seed, empowering farmers to get the job done and meeting the growing need for agricultural drone services throughout our Buckeye state. They’re also making our region proud by working on building an all American-made drone!

I appreciated getting a tour of their facilities and hearing about the impact they’re making in our region.

Adams County Regional Water provides water to 21,000 residents in Adams County.

It was great stopping by their facility to chat with General Manager Rick Adamson about the critical role they’ve played in our community over the years and their need to replace outdated infrastructure.

I’m committed to working with local leaders to advocate for the infrastructure needs of our region in Congress so our communities can thrive.

The Adams Rural Electric (REA) Co-op just celebrated their 85th year in business and currently serves 7,500 customers over 1300 miles throughout Adams, Brown, Highland, Pike and Scioto Counties.

I heard from Ericka Ackley about how the company’s early beginnings in 1935 paved the way for the magnitude of people they serve today. REA is a customer-driven, community-oriented co-op providing electricity services to the most rural Ohioans in the Second Congressional District.

Southern Ohio is grateful for the excellent service that Ericka and her team provide to our region!

It was an honor to attend the groundbreaking for the Liberty Landing redevelopment in New Richmond earlier this month alongside @GovMikeDeWine, the @ClermontCounty Commissioners, State Rep. Adam Bird, and local officials.

This $13.4 million project, funded through Ohio’s Appalachian Community Grant program, will transform the riverfront with a 300-foot marina, event space, improved streetscape, expanded dining areas, and enhanced public amenities.

I’m looking forward to watching this space boost tourism, support local businesses, and provide new recreational opportunities for both residents and visitors!

The Lightstone/Gavin Power Plant is a 2,600-megawatt supercritical coal-fired power station in Cheshire, Ohio, capable of generating enough electricity to power two million homes. It is the largest coal-fired power facility in Ohio and one of the largest in the U.S.

It was amazing to tour their facilities and talk with staff there about the critical role they play in supporting our region. To maintain energy independence, America must have power plants like Gavin Power producing enough energy to meet our region’s needs. I’m grateful to General Manager Garrett Watterson and his dedicated team for their time showing me around!

The Clinton County Economic Quarterly Investors Forum brings together local elected officials, business leaders, and community stakeholders to discuss the needs and priorities of businesses in our region. I had the pleasure of joining them and sharing what I’m doing in Congress to help southern Ohio small businesses, farmers, and local economy thrive.

By voting for the One Big Beautiful Bill, I supported historic tax cuts for Ohio farmers and small businesses, incentivized American manufacturing and local jobs, and the extension of many benefits from the TCJA. Southern Ohio has great potential for growth, and the One Big Beautiful Bill delivers critical tools that regions like ours need to grow and thrive. 

As a member of @TransportGOP, I’m advocating for rural infrastructure to support growth throughout our region. I look forward to staying in touch with local leaders and business owners so I can be an effective voice for them in Congress. Thank you to @CountyPort and each business represented at the Forum for having me!

Executive Director Jane Newkirk and her staff at Clinton County Community Action provide a multitude of services to our community, including early childhood education, senior programs, and community support initiatives. It was a pleasure joining Jane as well as Commissioners Brenda Woods, Mike McCarty, and Kerry Steed for a tour of their facilities to see firsthand where they run their @HeadStartgov program, Early Learning Center, and Senior Center.

We discussed the critical role that federal programs play in providing services to Clinton County. The committed staff here at CCCA show up every day to ensure Ohioans in any stage of life have the helping hand they need to be successful. In Congress, I will continue advocating for critical services like this one that serve Ohioans so well.

It was great meeting with Clinton County Engineer Jeff Linkous to discuss ongoing and upcoming infrastructure projects in the county and ways the federal government can provide support.

As a member of @TransportGOP, I’m committed to advancing projects that will benefit communities across Ohio’s Second Congressional District.

The team at @CincinnatiVamc is committed to providing our Nation’s Heroes with the high quality healthcare and support they deserve, employing more than 2,600 Ohioans and serving over 47,000 veterans. 

I met with Acting Medical Center Director Jim Hall and Acting Associate Director Benjamin Billon to hear about the services they provide to veterans in the Cincinnati area and see their facilities firsthand.

They shared how the center will be transitioning to the Federal Electronic Health Record system in the summer of 2026, their needs for infrastructure improvements, and their plan to have a new Community Based Outpatient Clinic in Union Township completed in the fall of 2026. I am a staunch supporter of our Nation’s veterans and am honored to continue advocating for their needs and for the needs of our local VA medical centers in Congress.

It was great meeting with members of the leadership team at @cincinnatimetro & talking with CEO & General Manager Andy Aiello, and Deputy Innovation & Vision Officer Khaled Shammout about Metro’s efforts to develop Bus Rapid Transit corridors in the region, their partnership with Clermont Transportation Connection, & what the unique needs are of southwestern Ohio’s transportation systems.

As a member of @TransportGOP, I’m advocating for Ohio’s highways & transit systems to ensure our Buckeye families, businesses, & industries have safe & reliable ways to get where they need to go.

Congress must pass a balanced budget to keep our Nation on track.

This week I joined the @OhioChamber forum with @Rep_Davidson to share what I’m doing in Congress to support Ohio’s businesses, improve our local economy, & pass a responsible budget.

https://t.co/8HpX65JILd

The @ValeroEnergy Renewables Bloomingburg plant produces ethanol, dried-distillers grains, livestock feed, and fuel- and feed-grade corn oil. Getting its start in early 2008, the plant was acquired by Valero in January 2010 and currently employs about 60 Ohioans. 

This plant goes through a whopping 150,000 bushels a day of corn! I got quite the tour from plant manager Zach Beversdorf and enjoyed talking with @OhioCornWheat Luke Crumley as well who joined for the day.

As a member of @HouseAgGOP, I regularly advocate for the needs of Ohio’s farmers, ranchers, and producers, and am a staunch supporter of the businesses and manufacturers that use their goods. Companies like Valero take corn and create critical products that are used not only in our immediate region, but across our Nation as well. Thank you to their team for sharing with me about your industry’s needs and priorities. I’ll take this knowledge back with me to Washington, DC to be an effective voice for Ohio’s agriculture and manufacturing industries!

Today I was honored to attend the unveiling of the Williamsburg Barn Mural, part of @ClermontCounty’s America 250 celebration! 

This mural pays tribute to the community’s rich history and heritage, featuring a historic church and home that still stand in Williamsburg. The glowing candles depicted in the windows symbolize safe houses along the Underground Railroad, where freedom seekers once found refuge. As one of several murals being created across Clermont County in recognition of America’s upcoming 250th anniversary in 2026, this artwork helps bring local history to life while connecting past generations to the present through public art.

It was great joining this special event today!

Established in 1930 and covering 1200 acres in Vinton County, Ohio, Red Diamond is @AustinPowderCo’s core manufacturing plant in North America. The plant was developed to help the company support our Nation’s expanding mining needs and produce materials integral to the industry.

Red Diamond is Vinton County’s largest employer, employing around 250 Ohioans in positions ranging from laborers, operators, engineers, mechanics, electricians, security, truck drivers, lab technicians, chemists, and other support personnel.

I appreciated getting a tour of their facility from plant manager Chris Wakefield and hearing about the economic impact they’re making in Vinton County.

I had the pleasure of meeting Andy Head and his team at A&P Technology recently and seeing how they work to create low-cost fuselages as well as wing structures for the Air Force’s critical unmanned military aircraft. 

Southern Ohio is proud to be home to companies like this one which not only create great local jobs but also work with our Nation’s military to promote national defense. A&P does it all in collaboration with the Air Force Research Laboratory within the DMAAPS framework to keep America protected at home and abroad.
 
Thank you to Andy and the team for showing me around and for the great work you do in our region!

Charity & I are thinking of & praying for those impacted by the senseless violence at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis.

School should be a safe place for children to go to learn. No child, parent, teacher, or school district should have to face this kind of tragedy & our hearts are with them today.

Calling high school seniors! Are you interested in serving our country in the military and getting a top-tier education at one of our Nation’s service academies?

My office is accepting applications for military academy nominations with a deadline of September 12th. I am honored to get to nominate southern Ohio’s best and brightest and hope you’ll apply!

Visit https://t.co/aUuk85l5hi for application requirements and more information.

There is absolutely no reason why states should allow CDL drivers on their roads who, by not understanding English, are costing Americans their lives.

@SecDuffy is right and Congress must pass Connor’s Law to codify President Trump’s common sense executive order into law!

The One Big Beautiful Bill is the helping hand Ohio farmers, ranchers, and producers need so they can keep food on our families’ tables.

I was proud to support it and will continue advocating in Congress for the needs of Ohio’s local agriculture industry! https://t.co/nhDn9SDWOR

Cam spent this summer as an intern in my Washington, DC office and was a great help to my staff!

He helped answer constituent calls, gave Capitol tours, and assisted in day-to-day office operations.

I’m grateful for the time he spent serving the great people of OH-02 and look forward to the bright future ahead of him!

A few months ago, I expressed my concerns to @SecRollins in a @HouseAgGOP hearing about how prime American farmland is being wasted by being covered with solar panels. This is risking our Nation’s food supply chain and jeopardizing the livelihood of American farmers.

Secretary Rollins expressed her full support of removing federal funding for solar panels on prime farmland and this week, she and the Trump Administration delivered on that promise.

Promises made, promises kept! 🇺🇲

.@SecDuffy is exactly right.

If you want to drive a commercial vehicle on American roads, you should be able to read the roads signs.

My bill, Connor’s Law, would ensure that all CDL holders can read warning signs to keep everyone safe on the road and Congress should pass it.

This is a HISTORIC moment for American farmers! Absolutely NO taxpayer dollars should go toward solar panels on prime farmland.

Do you agree?

A HUGE win for farmers in Ohio & across the Nation! 

President Trump & his Administration are securing our Nation’s food supply chain & showing American farmers that they have their backs.

I was proud to introduce the Protecting American Farmland Act with @Rep_Davidson & @RepHageman, and I urge Congress to pass it ASAP to codify President Trump’s agenda into law to benefit farmers for years to come!

VEGA provides pressure, weight, level, and density services for tanks and pipelines to support industries spanning from food production to energy and beyond.

It was great visiting their Mason facility with Charity and sitting down with President and CEO John Groom, VP of Manufacturing Ron Foltz, VP of Administration Scott Rollman, and Nikkie White to discuss pertinent initiatives and highlight the growth and success of VEGA that is making Southern Ohio Proud.

Thank you to VEGA for having me, and I look forward to the ways you’ll continue to support southern Ohio businesses in 2026 and beyond!

Agriculture is the backbone of southern Ohio, propelled forward by the tireless work of our incredible farmers, ranchers, and producers.

I was honored to join the @ClermontCounty @OhioFarmBureau Annual Meeting recently to share updates about what I’m doing in Congress to have our farmers’ backs. I shared how the One Big Beautiful Bill provides historic support for farmers, including increasing the Death Tax exemption, expanding trade markets, and establishing unprecedented tax cuts to help farmers and small businesses keep up with expenses.

As the Co-Chair of the Congressional Rural Broadband Caucus, I’m also advocating for broadband expansion across rural Ohio so Ohio farmers and farming families can have access to the tools they need to succeed.

A huge thank you to the Farm Bureau for having me as I continue to fight for the unique needs of Ohio’s farmers in Congress!

Thank you to @Rep_Clyde, @RepLaMalfa, @RepArrington, @RepAderholtNews, @RepMaryMiller, @RepRonEstes, @RepRussFulcher, @RepEllzey, @RepSheriBiggs & Rep. Christopher Smith for joining us to introduce this family-first bill to protect kids & parental rights.

No one should be taking children across state lines to receive secret abortions behind their parents’ backs. Our Nation’s laws should protect our children from vulnerability, not open them up to coercion from oppressors trying to evade accountability from parents & the law.

That’s why I introduced the Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act with @RepBobOnder & @RepMarkHarrisNC -- to put parents back in the equation while protecting both their child and the lives of the unborn.

I recently toured @impactingtmrw in Miami Township with Miami Township Trustee Ken Tracy and his wife, Libby, who offered me a warm welcome alongside Police Chief Robert Hirsch and Township Administrator Steve Kelly.

The vast services Impacting Tomorrow offers include food, clothing, and healthcare support to our region. I’m grateful for the irreplaceable roles they play in the lives of countless Ohioans!

I recently toured the IPM Food Pantry in Union Township with President and CEO Melissa Meyer, Senior Director Nicole Jacquez, and board member Jane Portman. What stood out to me during my visit was IPM’s longstanding commitment to ensuring Eastern Cincinnati communities do not go hungry.

2023 was a stand-out year for IPM, where 1.3 million pounds of food were distributed through key programs like Drive-Through, Pop-up, Backpack of Basics, and Fresh Start Kitchen. IPM’s innovative outreach, like the pop-up events they put on at senior living centers, is aligned with their mission to reach those most in need across the region.

In Congress, I’m committed to protecting critical programs that serve those most in need in our communities. The One Big Beautiful Bill that President Trump signed into law roots out fraud and abuse in food assistance programs to ensure available resources are protected to help the most vulnerable Ohioans get back on their feet. I was proud to support it and will continue working hard in Congress to ensure our community’s needs are met!

Had California not handed out CDLs to illegal immigrants, three innocent Americans would still be alive today. Their deaths were entirely preventable. If someone is here illegally or can’t read our road signs, they should not be allowed to drive a commercial vehicle on American roads.
